answers.answer: My ob has mentioned that they might induce me at 39 weeks so I have been researching like crazy lol. From what I've read if there is a legit medical reason they want to get your lo out at 35 weeks you and your baby should be fine. But unfortunately there are always risks. Make sure to ask your dr if they have done everything they can do with induction being the last alternative. And if they have I really do think you will be fine. Good luck and let us know how it goes:)

Baby could spend a couple of weeks in the NICU, but if they want to induce you at 35 weeks, it's what's best for your safety and baby's. willtowin is right, they don't induce early for no reason. It will be okay and at the end of it you will have your precious baby!
Thank you ladies!!! This is so nerve racking!
Best of luck for you and Baby! I hope you both the healthiest delivery. Please keep us updated! You'll be the first in the group.

Ok I had my appointment this morning and they are going to run a few more tests. I have to do a 24 hour urine, ugh. Then go back on Wednesday and then they will tell me when they are going to induce me. It will be next week on Monday or Tuesday!

question: So ladies I am 34 weeks right now and my doctor wants to induce me next week because of preeclampsia. I am a little scared. I am a FTM and all of this is so overwhelming. I am also a single mom with very little support so I am very nervous. I am blessed with a very good doctor though. I am 35 and this will be my first and only child. I have heard induction is hard and takes longer. Have any of you ladies been induced this early and is it bad for the baby to be a month premature?
title: Induced at 35 weeks
